title: Caroline Flack is a big fan of being UK's most dangerous online celeb
text:
Caroline Flack knocked Kim Kardashian off the top spot (Picture: Getty)

Caroline Flack has joked that being named the most dangerous celebrity to search for on the internet is exactly like her Strictly Come Dancing success in 2014.

‘Haven’t felt like this since I won Strictly,’ the Love Island presenter tweeted on Tuesday as she shared a report that revealed that the search term Caroline Flack links through to the most malicious websites and viruses.

The research, carried out by McAfee, revealed that the 39-year-old had knocked Kim Kardashian off the top spot.

Game Of Thrones star Maisie Williams and presenter James Corden rounded out the top three.

Kim Kardashian’s name has fallen to 26th, suggesting that the power of a reality star name is waning, while rapper Nicki Minaj and 2019 break out star Billie Eilish also feature in this year’s top five.

Haven’t felt like this since I won strictly 😂 https://t.co/C8PFLMDNFf — caroline flack (@carolineflack1) October 22, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘People want to keep up to date with the latest pop culture and celebrity news at any time from any device,’ said McAfee’s chief scientist Raj Samani.

‘Often consumers put that speed and convenience over security by clicking on suspicious links that promise content featuring our favourite celebrities.

‘Consumers need to think before they click to be sure that they are surfing to safe digital content and protecting themselves from cyber-security threats that may be used to infect their devices or steal their identity.’

Maisie was named one of the top three most dangerous names to search for online (Picture: BBC)

The data was collated by the security firm who measured how many search results featuring a celebrity name contained links to sites that could potentially connect your computer to malware which may disrupt your software, steal private data or even gain total access to your device.

Frozen star Josh Gad, The OC actress Mischa Barton, musicians Sam Smith and Dua Lipa and Miley Cyrus’ ex-husband Liam Hemsworth make up the rest of the top 10.

The cyber-security firm urged internet users to refrain from using illegal streaming sites, warning they are ‘riddled’ with viruses disguised as video files.

It also encouraged parents to take advantage of parental control tools to help better patrol what their children can access online.

description: Caroline Flack named most dangerous celebrity to search for online
